name: North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences
description: Experience dinosaur exhibits, live animals, and immersive learning in the largest natural history museum in the Southeast.

name: Marbles Kids Museum
description: Hands-on exhibits, interactive play areas, and an IMAX theatre for children of all ages.

name: Pullen Park
description: Features a historic carousel, paddle boats, playgrounds, and plenty of green space for family fun.

name: JC Raulston Arboretum
description: A nationally acclaimed garden featuring diverse plant collections and educational programs.

name: North Carolina State Capitol
description: Completed in 1840, this historic building offers guided tours and showcases neoclassical architecture.

name: Historic Yates Mill County Park
description: Home to a fully restored, water-powered gristmill and scenic hiking trails around the pond.

name: Mordecai Historic Park
description: Features the birthplace of Andrew Johnson and the beautifully preserved Mordecai House.

name: Raleigh Flea Market
description: Offers a variety of vendors selling collectibles, antiques, and local produce at the NC State Fairgrounds.
